Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the situation by stating that "all" coronavirus tests submitted by nurses are coming back positive, without providing sufficient evidence to support this claim.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide enough evidence or data to support the assertion that all coronavirus tests are coming back positive.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the labs processing coronavirus tests are deliberately falsifying results, without providing any evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the increase in COVID-19 cases, such as increased community spread or changes in testing protocols.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that false-positive results are rare and that experts are more concerned about false-negatives in COVID-19 tests.
Understate: The claim may be understating the accuracy and reliability of COVID-19 tests by suggesting that false-positive results are common or widespread, without providing sufficient evidence to support this claim.
